contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox mountain | name = Mount Rokkō | other_name = 六甲山 | photo = Mt rokko01s2816.jpg | photo_caption = | elevation_m = 931.6 | elevation_ref = | prominence = | listing = | language = Japanese | pronunciation = {{IPA-ja|ɽokːoːsaɴ|lang}} | location = [[Kobe]], [[Hyōgo Prefecture|Hyōgo]], [[Japan]] | range = [[Rokkō Mountains]] | coordinates = {{coord|34|46|40|N|135|15|50|E|type:mountain}} | topo = | type = Fault-block | age = | last_eruption = | first_ascent = | easiest_route = }} [[File:View of Kikuseidai from Mount Maya Kobe.jpg|thumb|280px|View of [[Kikuseidai]] from Mount Maya]] {{nihongo|'''Mount Rokkō'''|六甲山|Rokkō-san}} is a name of a group of mountains in [[Hyōgo Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. This mountain is one of [[Hyōgo 50 mountains]], [[Kinki 100 mountains]], and also one of [[the 300 famous mountains in Japan]]. == Outline == [[File:六甲山最高峰 "The Peak of Mount Rokkō".jpg|thumb|150px|left|alt=931|Marker at the highest peak of Mount Rokkō]] There is no single mountain or peak called "Rokkō." The highest peak of the mountains is called {{nihongo|Rokkōsan-Saikōhō|六甲山最高峰}}, literally, the highest peak in Rokkō Mountains. The mountains spread from [[Sumaura Kōen|Sumaura Kōen Park]] in the west end of [[Kobe]], to [[Takarazuka, Hyogo|Takarazuka]], and the length of the mountains ranges is about 56 km. The highest point is 931m. It includes [[Mount Maya]], [[Mount Kabutoyama]], [[Mount Iwahara]] and [[Mount Iwakura]]. Today, the Rokkō mountain area is a centerpiece of a popular sightseeing and hiking area for people in the metropolitan area in Kansai region. Mt. Rokkō is a symbol of [[Kobe]] as well as [[Osaka]]. == History == [[Arthur Hasketh Groom]] opened the first golf course in Japan, [[Kobe Golf Club]], on Mt. Rokko in 1903. == Points of interest== * [[Rokkō Alpine Botanical Garden]] * [[Nunobiki Herb Garden]] * [[Nunobiki Falls]] == Trivia == For many years, lenses made by the [[Minolta]] Camera Company were designated as "Rokkor", named after this sacred mountain near Osaka, where the company was headquartered. == Access == * [[Rokkō Sanjō Staition]] of [[Rokkō Cable Line]] * [[Kinenhidai Bus Stop]] of [[Hankyu Bus]] * [[Hoshi no Eki Station]] of [[Maya Cable]] ==Gallery== <gallery> File:Hotakako01.JPG|Lake Hotaka File:Mikuniike02s1920.jpg|Lake Mikuni File:Rokko garden terrace02s3872.jpg|Rokko Garden Terrace File:Kamakurakyo01.JPG|[[Kamakura Valley]] File:Rokko alpine botanical garden04s2816.jpg|[[Rokkō Alpine Botanical Garden]] File:FrozenWaterFall1.JPG| Frozen Nanamagari Waterfall File:Kobe Nunobiki Herb Garden08n4272.jpg|[[Nunobiki Herb Garden]] File:Odaki, from the Nunobiki Falls.jpg|[[Nunobiki Falls]] </gallery> == See also == {{commons category|The mountainous region of Rokko}} * [[Hōrai Valley]] * [[Kamakura Valley]] * [[Rokkō oroshi]] - gale blowing down from Mt.
